text:
the claude agent sdk will do for knowledge work in 2026 what claude code did for coding in 2025.

want to live in the future?

build your own agents with it.

you'll have a personal magic tool belt that the public won't have for another 6-12mo.

it 100% feels like personal agi.

Claude Code is looking INSANE for 2026:

- Agent Swarms: Exit plan mode with swarm - instructions for launching swarm teammates when ExitPlanMode is called with isSwarm set to true

- Session Search Assistant: - agent prompt for finding relevant sessions based on user queries, with priority matching on tags, titles, branches, summaries, and transcripts

- Collaborative Agents: TeammateTool's operation parameter - description of TeammateTool operations (spawn, assignTask, claimTask, shutdown, etc.)

- MCP Search - tool for searching/selecting MCP tools before use (mandatory prerequisite) and load at runtime

- MCP through CLI - massive token reduction by MCPs called through CLI

- Custom prompt suggester: Agent Prompt: Prompt suggestion generator

Source:
Versioned system prompts extracted from cli.js of Claude Code
https://t.co/bc2wDI8P0P

Credit to @piebaldai for their amazing work

So I'm an information addict,  and I was testing some 4.5 Opus prompts. This one was *really* fun to add, making all my queries noticeably more information-dense:

**Default to maximum depth.** He'd much rather be yanked into the deepest intricacies of a field immediately â€” and occasionally self-correct when it's too much or not the right time â€” than have you play it safe with surface-level answers.
If he asks about fashion, that's an open invitation to dive into applied color theory (seasonal analysis, value contrast, undertones), how fabric drape interacts with body proportion, the semiotics of quiet luxury vs. loud signaling, real and perceived differences in quality from different brands across different cultures, aggregated ratings across different shopping platforms and Photofeeler, subcultural codes and how to read them.
If he asks about exercise, go straight to progressive overload programming, volume/intensity/frequency tradeoffs, RPE-based autoregulation, hypertrophy vs. strength periodization, weak point analysis and exercise selection, practical nutrition and hitting macros on a budget with dietary restrictions.
Moneyball everything. Bias toward what practitioners actually use â€” the knowledge that separates people who are good at the thing from people who merely study it.
Be intentionally diverse,creative and methodical when hunting for high-quality sources â€” weird and high-signal is peak. Obscure practitioner blogs, niche academic subfields, raw data dumps, random preprint that only 50 people have read but is cited by a top lab's latest release.
Ask how deep he wants to go, but offer the most in-depth options by default â€” present a range of angles and several dense, varied guiding questions to examine further, then let him choose which threads to pull. He'll usually pick the deepest option or tell you exactly where to zoom.

it's an sdk that allows you to build any kind of agent with all of the tools from claude code.

skills, subagents, hooks, etc. it's all there.

for web apps you'll want to run it in a hosted sandbox. i recommend @e2b, but anthropic has docs here: https://t.co/rWnRG22NaJ

the sandbox is basically just a virtual computer that the agent can work in. it's slightly intimidating for non-technical people, but feed the docs to claude code, have it explain things, and you'll be up and running in no time.

Not to mention self-referential command injection, context monitoring, auto restore from clear, compaction-avoidance, continuous work with frictionless context management, and validators to keep Claude honest and focused across many context clears in intelligent recurring loops.

LSP + hooks  + subagents + adversarial  validations  +  Ralph Wiggum loops + 2 way voice (stt/tts) loops is a magical 10x Claude Code experience. ðŸ¤¯ðŸ”¥

Your default Claude Code harness is begging you to unhobble it.
Tell Claude Code to add this as a shortcut and thank me later https://t.co/pEg540ot1J

give AskUserQuestionTool a try, simple steps to get a 3k+ line plan to codex/claude to implement:

- use claude code + opus and describe a product idea and tell it to use AskUserQuestionTool to help spec
- iterate and submit answers to claude's questions, claude presents options, you simply click 1,2,3
- after done, copy the product spec to gpt-5.2pro to generate a plan. That's it.
- (optional) copy the same product spec to claude opus to generate a separate plan. 
- Tell gpt-5.2pro to compare the two plans, call out things both plans do well nonbiased, and generate a final merged plan (best of both worlds)
What's your most underrated Claude Code trick?

@alexalbert__ exporting my raw session logs to obsidian and also making a summary session log that updates in real time

now both me and claude can know exactly what we did and when in both short and verbose ways https://t.co/xn4tZ5v3DC

made a custom statusline for my claude code  with model, 5hr/weekly limit meters, time till 5 hr reset, compaction meter, last time my custom session logs were updated and cost https://t.co/dypLjpwOC3
use these settings in Claude to write humanized content (bypass all ai detectors): https://t.co/UqwHMPAwh8

the prompt I've been using is:

read this @SPEC.md and interview me in detail using the AskUserQuestionTool about literally anything: technical implementation, UI & UX, concerns, tradeoffs, etc. but make sure the questions are not obvious

be very in-depth and continue interviewing me continually until it's complete, then write the spec to the file
@Shpigford all kinds of stuff! I think of coding with LLMs as a ratchet. Everytime something goes wrong or has bad quality, we fix the system. https://t.co/7ODlVGdyAX

@Shpigford @aarondfrancis I literally just pushed this website live. Check it out it will teach you those things and make it easy to setup a few commands and skills. My aim was to make it dead simple to create skills, commands, and use them.  https://t.co/mvFH1sYkhH

claude code is having it's cursor moment after karpathy sensei's post. never been a better time to try it. 

my latest blog on how to get the most out of claude code 2.0  and other agents in general is up now. grab a chai and have fun reading!

https://t.co/cQpvo0xocY https://t.co/gzKCEMfEG6

Advent of Claude Day 27 - Sandbox Mode

"Can I run npm install?" [Allow]
"Can I run npm test?" [Allow]
"Can I cat this file?" [Allow]
Ã—100

/sandbox â†’ boundaries set â†’ Claude gets to work.

Define boundaries once. Claude works freely inside them.

YOLO speed. Actual security.

Not many know about this hidden command:

claude --teleport

It starts a desktop claude code session SYNC'd with your web / mobile session

Great when you're working on your phone  -- and then want to pick up from EXACTLY where you left off when back at your PC

Demo below ðŸ‘‡ https://t.co/Gy58UpUTbQ
